newsitem.title: MACEDONIA: Macedonia's Komercijalna Bank changes director.
newsitem.headline: Macedonia's Komercijalna Bank changes director.

text.p: Komercijalna Banka, Macedonia's second largest, has replaced its current director Alexander Manevski with the country's representative at the World Bank, Hari Kostov, the bank said in a statement.
"Komercijalna Bank's board of directors decided to appoint Hari Kostov as director general as of October 23," it said.
Kostov was also deputy finance minister two years ago responsible for relations with multilateral lenders.

Manevski came under attack from the central bank a few months ago for allegedly pressuring the currency, the denar, on the local interbank market by keeping foreign exchange reserves above the permitted minimum in banks abroad, local media said.
Under a project signed with the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development, Komercijalna Banka has a 4.9 million European Currency Unit trade facility.
